result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Earnest McCottry III

records.addlTxt:
JusticePoint Violation Report dated October 27, 2022 - received
Court will review
Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

As to Counts  1 and 2:
Defendant advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties; waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of  GUILTY   as to both counts and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint and orders a judgment of conviction be entered.

As to Count  3:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court orders Count  3   DISMISSED but read-in as to sentencing.

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms; further, defendant is advised he cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

PSI not ordered.  Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 28.  Bail conditions to remain as previously set.

Jury trial is vacated from the court's calendar.  Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement received and filed.

Clerk:  jms

BRANCH 28 for BRANCH 4:

Defendant Earnest McCottry III in court.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court for Earnest McCottry III.  Attorney Daniel T Flaherty in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case is scheduled for jury trial on today's date.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Sanders.  Before case is reassigned, defense counsel asks for brief adjournment.  
Case passed.

Back on the record.
Defense counsel advises Court they are withdrawing the request for substitution.

Defendant is prepared to enter a plea.

Clerk:  jms

Parties contacted to advise to proceed to Honorable Judge Sanders Branch 28 in the Safety building room 620. JURY TRIAL SPUN TO BRANCH 28.
Jury trial scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.

Defendant Earnest McCottry III in court.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court for Earnest McCottry III.  Attorney Jennifer Jean Tate in court for the State of Wisconsin on behalf of Attorney Daniel Flaherty. Case in court for jury trial first call. Parties remain in trial posture and are ready to proceed to trial. Case passed until 10:15AM to address the rest of the Court's calendar. 

Case in court for jury trial second call: Discussion held off the record. Court advises parties to return at 1:30PM. Case passed. 

Discussion held with parties off the record as to posture of the case. Parties advised this case may be spun. Case adjourned until 8:30AM tomorrow unless a spin court becomes available. Case remains calendared in Br 4.
Jury trial scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.
State's 1st Supplemental Witness List, received and filed.

Defendant Earnest McCottry III in court.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn appeared by video for Earnest McCottry III.  Attorney Jennifer Tate for Daniel T Flaherty in court for State of Wisconsin. Final Pretrial held. Case remains in trial posture. State places offer on the record. Defendant rejected offer. Case remains calendared for Jury Trial, Branch 4.
Defendant's Proposed Jury Instructions, received and filed.
Defendant's Motion in Limine, received and filed.
Defendant's Witness List, received and filed
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.
State's Motion in Limine, received and filed.
State's Witness List, received and filed.

JusticePoint Pretrial Services VIOLATION Report received and filed.  

Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report dated 8-9-2022; Received, filed and forwarded to the Judge for review.

Defendant Earnest McCottry in court with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Earnest McCottry appeared by video means. 
Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed by the final pretrial date. Any other motions and notice of alibi must be filed by the final pretrial. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 4.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 8-2-2022, filed.

Defendant Earnest McCottry in court, appear by video with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn, appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judical notice to case 08CF4608. Sworn for the State: Detective E. Fitting .  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 04.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.

Defendant Earnest McCottry in court with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  Daniel T Flaherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant admonished for missing court. Court vacates stayed bench warrant. Defense waives time limits for prelim. Case adjourned in Branch prelim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court.  Daniel T Flaherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for State vs. Lee hearing. Counsel has been appointed by state public defender's office. Defendant fails to appear. Defense request calendar call. State does not object. Court grants. Court orders bench warrant, however stays warrant until the next court date. Case adjourned in Branch 4.  Calendar call scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.
received and filed.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.

Defendant Earnest McCottry not in court, defendant in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for cause to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.  Hearing scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Earnest McCottry not in court, defendant in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Earnest McCottry not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a Preliminary hearing. State's witness is present. SPD need more time to appoint counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Earnest McCottry in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Defendant Earnest McCottry in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Earnest McCottry appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
